meta.title: Use of Personal Protective Equipment Cabinet

sections.purpose: To store and organize personal protective equipment (PPE) such as gloves, masks, gowns, and goggles in a designated clean area.
sections.scope: Applicable to all staff and students working in the Pharmacology laboratory and animal house.
procedure: Arrange PPE items by type and size on labeled shelves or compartments.
Ensure only clean, unused PPE is stored in the cabinet.
Keep the cabinet doors closed when not in use to protect PPE from dust and contamination.
Replenish PPE stock regularly based on usage and minimum inventory levels.
Display PPE donning and doffing instructions near the cabinet.
Inspect PPE periodically for expiry, damage, or contamination and remove unsuitable items.
precautions: Do not store personal items or chemicals in the PPE cabinet.
Ensure easy access to the cabinet in emergency situations.
Keep flammable materials away from the cabinet.
Follow institutional infection control policies for PPE selection and use.
Dispose of damaged or expired PPE as biomedical waste.
